title.narrative: OPT 1. 1. DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF IECD POLICY

description.narrative: 1.1. The Government has increased capacity to design and implement an integrated early childhood development policy and institutional framework to take interventions to scale., which contributes to Early Childhood Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children between 0 and 5 have access to Integrated Early Childhood Development (IECD) services to guarantee that they survive and thrive, including in emergency situations.

related-activity.ref: 0510/A0/05/401 OCM 1. EVERY CHILD SURVIVES AND THRIVES

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.1. The Government has increased capacity to design and implement an integrated early childhood development policy and institutional framework to take interventions to scale.

description.narrative: The National Sub-Council on Integrated Early Childhood, led by the Vice Ministry of Equal Opportunities (VIO) and with multisectoral participation, reviewed the draft IECD Policy at its first annual meeting in February 2019. If the political context allows it, the IECD participatory mechanism now created, will ensure the ratification of the Integrated Early Childhood Development (IECD) Policy and Law in 2020. The draft policy was developed in 2018 with technical support from UNICEF. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Integrated Early Childhood Development (IECD) National Policy developed, including specific interventions in emergency situations

actual.value: 2018:Design of a multisectorial public Policy for IECD at national level (produced with the Ministry of Justice/ VIO, pending final validation and official approval), and at municipal level in El Alto. (Municipal Policy for IECD drafted).

title.narrative: # of municipal governments that adopt integrated risk management and climate change adaptation plans that include early childhood

target.value: 2022:9 (El Alto, La Paz, Independencia, Chimore, Puerto Villarroel, Santa Cruz, Montero, Cobija, Puerto Gonzalo Moreno)

title.narrative: Integrated territorial development plans (PTDI in Spanish) and annual operating plans (AOPs) include actions to implement IECD policy
ECD is integrated in UNICEF's emergency preparedness and response plan and implementation

target.value: 2020:ECD is integrated in EPP and COVID-19 Plan

actual.value: 2018:The EPP Platform of Bolivia CO has integrated ECD

title.narrative: ECD Partnerships, including ECD Action Network (ECDAN), established at national level to coordinate the programme interventions and advocacy

target.value: 2020:3 ( 1 at national level and 2 at municipal level. IECD intersectorial Platform functioning with IECD Scorecard)
